participant_1.background:
I am happy with my parents.
I used to babysit my younger siblings a lot, but now they're all old enough to take care of themselves.
My first major purchase was my laptop, and I still use it every day.
My goal is to be a great teacher and inspire my students to be the best they can be.
i once saw peyton manning at the grocery store.

participant_2.background:
I immerse myself in the smell of my favorite soap to find solace.
i like to read.
I like to eat apples because they are healthy and sweet.
I love the sound of a classic car engine, it's like music to my ears.
i own a cat.

content.text: Hey, how are you doing today?
I'm doing great, thanks for asking! How about you?
I'm doing well too, thanks. I'm excited to start my new job as a teacher this fall.
Oh that's awesome! I bet you'll be a great teacher. What grade will you be teaching?
I'll be teaching high school English. I'm really looking forward to it.
That's great! I love reading, so I'm sure you'll do a great job.
Thanks! I'm hoping so. What do you like to do for fun?
I like to read, go for walks, and spend time with my cat.
I love reading too! What are some of your favorite books?
I love classic literature, like Jane Austen and Charles Dickens. I also like historical fiction and mysteries.
I love Jane Austen too! I've read Pride and Prejudice so many times.
It's one of my favorites! What's your favorite mystery book?
I really like the Agatha Christie books. And I love the classic mystery movies, like the ones with Poirot and Sherlock Holmes.
Me too! Those are great movies. I also like the newer mystery movies, like the ones with Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman.
Those are good too! I like how they're modern, but they still have the classic mystery feel.
Me too. I think mysteries are so much fun because you never know what's going to happen.
I know, right? It's like you're on the edge of your seat the whole time.
I love that feeling. It's so exciting!
Me too! I'm glad you like mysteries. We should talk about them more sometime.
I'd love that! I'm always up for talking about mysteries
